metadata.title: CVE-2019-1010127 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
VCFTools vcftools prior to version 0.1.15 is affected by: Use-after-free. The impact is: Denial of Service or possibly other impact (eg. code execution or information disclosure). The component is: The header::add_FILTER_descriptor method in header.cpp. The attack vector is: The victim must open a specially crafted VCF file. It was discovered that VCFtools improperly handled memory allocation/deallocation, resulting in a use-after-free vulnerability. If a victim were tricked into opening a specially crafted VCF File, an attacker could cause VCFtools to leak sensitive information or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1010127` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vcftools - 0.1.16-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vcftools package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.1.16-1').
